DataElement.preferredName: Clinical Performed Observation Outcome Biomarker Flag ISO21090.BL.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Specifies whether a result is considered a biomarker.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Clinical Performed Observation Outcome Biomarker Flag
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.:Executed and carried through to completion.:Watching something and taking note of what happens.:The result of an action._A xenobiotically-induced variation in cellular or biochemical components or processes, structures, or functions that is objectively measurable in a biological system and characterizes normal biologic processes, pathogenic processes, an organism's state of health or disease, likelihood of developing a disease, prognosis, or response to a particular therapeutic intervention. Biomarkers include but not limited to such phenotypic parameters as specific enzyme or hormone concentration, specific gene phenotype, presence or absence of biological substances.:An indicator that can be set or unset in order to signal whether a particular condition is true.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.:Executed and carried through to completion.:Watching something and taking note of what happens.:The result of an action.

Concepts.definition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.
Executed and carried through to completion.
Watching something and taking note of what happens.

Property.preferredDefinition: A xenobiotically-induced variation in cellular or biochemical components or processes, structures, or functions that is objectively measurable in a biological system and characterizes normal biologic processes, pathogenic processes, an organism's state of health or disease, likelihood of developing a disease, prognosis, or response to a particular therapeutic intervention. Biomarkers include but not limited to such phenotypic parameters as specific enzyme or hormone concentration, specific gene phenotype, presence or absence of biological substances.:An indicator that can be set or unset in order to signal whether a particular condition is true.

Concepts.definition: A characteristic that can be objectively measured and serves as an indicator for normal biologic processes, pathogenic processes, state of health or disease, the risk for disease development and/or prognosis, or responsiveness to a particular therapeutic intervention.
An indicator that can be set or unset in order to signal whether a particular condition is true.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: DEC released per model owner approval. mc 2/2/11

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Health Informatics - Harmonized data types for information interchange

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 2/19/13 Added AIM Foundation Model CSI reference. jc
